intro: Thyrsanthema sinuata, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its silvery, fuzzy leaves and bright yellow daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and bloom. Thyrsanthema sinuata is also valued for its drought tolerance and ability to attract pollinators.
